summary: The document is a journal entry from the Office of Legislative Counsel dated 10 November 1977, detailing various liaison activities and employment requests involving representatives and their staff, as well as interactions with the CIA and other committees. It includes both unclassified and secret communications, highlighting the routine yet sensitive nature of legislative and intelligence liaison work during that period.
key_findings: Employment inquiries and requests were handled between congressional offices and the Office of Personnel.
Liaison activities included forwarding press releases and publications to congressional offices.
Meetings were arranged between CIA officials and the Chief Counsel of the House Select Committee on Assassinations.
Privacy Act requests from the Select Committee staff were acknowledged without disclosing requester identities.
A Senate Select Committee on Intelligence staff member received a headquarters badge and reviewed national intelligence summaries related to foreign security services.
